title: Mars Rover - A Platformer #Games
description:
UPDATE: oh my gosh it's featured i can't deal with these messages i get like 10-15 every second

UPDATE 2: apparently i'll get extra credit in school for this being featured, very interesting

Update 3: No. 1 trending letsgooo!

update 4: project is starting to lose fame, just like 99% of projects (except griffpatch's projects)

Credits:
svgrepo.com for the rover, the spaceship at the end, the 2 satellites, and the Asteroid (which I turned into the 2 moons of Mars).
bensound.com for the music.
@griffpatch for basic platforming code
Scratch Sound library for wheel, laser, and Win sound effects (I edited 2 of the sounds, but they are still named the original name they had).
Open Sans font (thumbnail) - download it here: https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Open+Sans
Myself for basically everything else.

#Games
instructions:
HEADPHONE WARNING: Turn down your volume!
USE FULLSCREEN FOR BEST EXPERIENCE

Welcome to "Mars Rover - A Platformer!" Use left and right arrow keys or A and D keys to move the rover. There's a catch though - you can't jump, because you're a rover. The levels are of course built for that, but some might be similar to levels you would see in a normal platformer with jumping enabled.

On the last level (9), you have to move the rover to the rocketship and touch it to win. Sorry for the confusion.
